required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics, Safety, and Efficacy of Dolutegravir Dispersible Tablets in Young Children Living With HIV
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics, Safety, and Efficacy of Dolutegravir Dispersible Tablets in Young Children Living With HIV

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate steady-state pharmacokinetics of DTG dispersible tablets in children with HIV infection weighing from 6 to below 20 kg and to determine the dose of DTG that achieves adult target PK parameter(trough concentration; AUC24h)

detailed_description.textblock: After being informed about the study and potential risks, all legal guardians giving written informed consent will undergo check eligibility to enroll the study entry. Patients will be sort into 3 weight band groups 6 to below 10 kg, 10 to below 14 kg, and 14 to below 20 kg. ARTs will be switched to DTG dispersible tablet and ABC/3TC once daily will be prescribed according to weight band dosage. Total of 7 time point of blood sampling for plasma DTG concentrations will be measure at 7-14 day after medication switch. Patient will be follow up as schedule for total 24 week to assess safety, and efficacy of DTG dispersible tablet combine with ABC/3TC.

primary_outcome.measure: Steady-state pharmacokinetics of DTG dispersible tablets in children with HIV infection
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 7-14 day after started on DTG
primary_outcome.description: Trough plasma DTG concentration and DTG exposure (AUC24h)

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of grade 3 and 4 adverse events in use of DTG for HIV treatment in

secondary_outcome.measure: Antiretroviral activity of dolutegravir dispersible tablets combined with two standard background therapies

arm_group.description: Children with perinatal HIV infection whose weight from 6 kg to below 10 kg
Children with perinatal HIV infection whose weight from 10 kg to below 14 kg
Children with perinatal HIV infection whose weight from 14 kg to below 20 kg

intervention.description: Give 2 tabs of MYLTEGA DT (10mg) PO once daily
Give 2.5 tabs of MYLTEGA DT (10mg) PO once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children living with HIV weighing 6 to below 20 kg
- Na√Øve to integrase inhibitors
Exclusion criteria:
- Currently active opportunistic infection
- Liver dysfunction (SGPT below 100 IU/mL)
- Renal dysfunction (GFR below 60 mL/min)
- Currently using medication that interacts with DTG
